Class BayesTrainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • danger_zone.BayesTrainer

  • public class BayesTrainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    2012-10-28 Class to overview the training of the Naive Bayes Algorithm from the Dataset.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeData

        public boolean initializeData(java.lang.String password)
        Initalizes the dataset, if a connection cannot be made the function returns false.
        Parameters:
        password - The password to connect to the database.
        Returns:
        returns true or false depending on whether the dataset is able to connect to the database.

      • trainBayes

        public void trainBayes()
        Trains the naive bayes on the entire data set.

      • classify

        public int classify(java.lang.String tweet)
        Trains the bayes on the tweet text.
        Parameters:
        tweet - The tweet string to be trained upon.

      • trainOnText

        public boolean trainOnText(java.lang.String text,
                  int cat)
        Trains the bayes on just text and category versus on a tweet.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be trained upon
        cat - The category the text belongs to true or false whether or not
        Returns:
        Returns true or false if the training was commited to the database.

      • commitTrain

        public boolean commitTrain(java.lang.String text,
                  int cat)
        Commits the text and category to the database that the naive bayes will train from. Without the training data being specifically a tweet.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to train on
        cat - the category to classify the text into.
        Returns:
        true if the data was commited to the database

      • validateOn

        public float validateOn(java.util.ArrayList<Training_Tweet> set)
        Checks to see the percentage correct on a set of training tweets.
        Parameters:
        set - Arraylist of Training Tweets to validate the bayes on.
        Returns:
        Returns the percentage correct on the validation set.

      • validateOn

        public float validateOn()
        Checks to see the percentage correct on a default training set. Validates on a fifth of the data set itself.
        Returns:
        Returns the percentage correct on the validation set.

      • crossValidation

        public void crossValidation()
        Performs K-fold cross validation with k=10 on the dataset. Partitions the full data set into 10 sets and performs the training and folds.

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String password,
       boolean debugOn)
        Runs the BayesTrainer, iniatlizes the database and then trains the bayes on it. TODO: Make it wait around and classify everything for us via some server socket interactions

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection to the DataSet

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
